product.title: Ahmed Garlic Pickle
product.description: The acetic acid in vinegar or the lactic acid produced by brine gives the pickle its salty, sour taste. ... Bread-and-butter pickles, for example, have a distinctly sweet taste because sugar and other sweeteners are added to the brine. Like tomatoes, cucumbers (and thus, pickles) are technically fruits.
